subject.topic: Southern University and A & M College

mods.abstract: Hamilton discusses his family, his segregated early education, his attendance at an integrated Robert E. Lee High School, race relations in Baton Rouge, the civil rights movement, activism among black students at LSU, the relationship between black students at LSU and Southern University, and his legal practice.
mods.note: Interview conducted by Mary J. Hebert.

titleInfo.title: T. Harry Williams Center for Oral History University History Series.

copyInformation.subLocation: LSU Special Collections: T. Harry Williams Center for Oral History

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
